rule: If the given word's part of speech can be determined and aligns with one of the part-of-speech tags in the alphabetical list provided, the output must be exactly one of those part-of-speech tags written in uppercase without any additional characters, spaces, or punctuation.
input: sentence: She sang beautifully in the concert., word: sang
validityText:
The input consists of a sentence "She sang beautifully in the concert." and a word "sang". 
The sentence is a grammatically valid string containing multiple words. It doesn't contain any unusual symbols.
The word "sang" is indeed a substring of the sentence. It doesn't include any punctuation that doesn't belong to the word itself. It matches a valid occurrence within the sentence.
Therefore, the input complies with all the given specifications.

OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot outputs a single word "VERB". The description asks for a part-of-speech tag, and "VERB" is a valid part-of-speech tag listed in the description. The output adheres to the rule of returning only the part-of-speech tag.
OK
